org.springframework.aop.framework
Interface DynamicMethodPointcut

All Superinterfaces:
MethodPointcut, StaticMethodPointcut
public interface DynamicMethodPointcut
extends StaticMethodPointcut

Interface to be implemented by objects that can cause conditional invocation of an Interceptor depending on the method, arguments and attributes passed. This differs from a static pointcut, which depends only on the static part of the joinpoint, and cannot involve arguments. Static pointcuts can be expected to outperform dynamic pointcuts, as it's possible to determine whether or not to apply the pointcut before processing individual method calls, meaning that a regular expression or the like may need to be evaluated only once.

Since:
03-Apr-2003

Method Detail

applies

public boolean applies(java.lang.reflect.Method m,
                       java.lang.Object[] arguments,
                       org.aopalliance.intercept.AttributeRegistry attributeRegistry)
Should the interceptor be invoked? This method is invoked before any interceptors have been invoked.
Parameters:
invocation - Some implementations may wish to decide whether their interceptor should be invoked based on the value of this object.
Returns:
boolean whether the interceptor referenced by this object should be invoked
